items.todoItem: Remember, as Paul did, that you belong to the Lord.
Live in a manner worthy of God’s calling in response to all that God has done for you.
Know that we are each called to our own vocation.
Know that our daily living before God should correspond to our high status as a child of God.
Know that it is impossible to live the Christian life without understanding biblical doctrine or principles from the Word of God.
Know that right doctrine is foundational to right living.
know that the Church is to live in a way that is worthy of Christ and that glorifies Him.
Walk with all lowliness and meekness, just as Jesus did.
Know that lowliness and meekness are of great price in the sight of God.
Walk free from pride in all humbleness of mind.
Know that humility is the opposite of pride.
Remain calm and in submission to the divine will, not easily provoked and without retaliation or murmuring at injury or provocation.
Know that long suffering, gentleness and meekness are fruits of the Spirit.
Exercise great patience and restraint with one another in godly love.
Know that bearing with one another in love involves receiving mistreatment from others without retaliation.
Know that love is the catalyst for our forbearing with others rather than resenting or hurting them.
Do all that you can to guard and uphold the unity of the Holy Spirit with fellow believers by remaining at peace with them.
Know that unity comes from the Holy Spirit.
Know that the role of the Church is to preserve unity and not to create it.
Know that humility promotes unity amongst believers.
Know that comparison of self with others creates problems that hinder unity.
Know that pride and envy destroy unity.
Know that attempting to create unity through uniformity and political correctness at the expense of truth is not biblical.
Know that there is only one body, the body of Christ: the Church.
Know that there is only one Holy Spirit.
Know that the power of the church does not come from anything other than the Holy Spirit.
Know that all believers share in the same joyful and confident expectation of eternal salvation to which they are called.
Know that there is only one Lord, the Lord Jesus Christ.
Know that there is only one true faith, faith in Jesus Christ.
Know that there is only one baptism, baptism into Christ.
Know that there is only one true God.
Know that God is the Father of all.
Know that God is over all, works through all and is in all believers.
Know that every believer is freely given a particular gift of grace by Jesus Christ.
Know that there is diversity within the body of Christ because of the different gifts given to each believer seperately by Jesus.
Know that God equips believers for service to King Jesus.
Know that there is room for every believer in the service of King Jesus to play their unique and necessary part in God’s plan.
Know that Jesus ascended up to heaven.
Know that when the risen Jesus ascended up on high He led captivity captive and gave gifts to men (the Church).
Take note how Paul refers to the divinity and works of the risen Jesus by referencing the scriptures (Psalms 68:18).
Know that the Son of God descended into the lower parts of the earth (Sheol) after His death for three days and three nights before His triumphant ascension.
Know that Jesus came down from heaven.
Know that the risen Jesus ascended back up to heaven so that He might fulfil all things (covenants and prophecies).
Know that Jesus gave gifted individuals to the Church for some to be apostles, some prophets, some evangelists and some pastors and teachers.
Know that apostles and prophets lay the foundations of the Church.
Know that evangelists are important catalysts for spreading the gospel.
Know that evangelists help people understand how to present the gospel.
Know that all of us have the responsibility for evangelism even though that may not be our gift.
Know that pastor-teachers are for the edification of the Church.
Know that the gifts of Jesus are for the equipping of the saints, for the work of the ministry and for the building up and teaching of the Church.
Know that each saint gets the gift of grace and has a part to play towards the building up of the Church which is the great objective of Christ’s gifts.
Know that the equipping of the saints prepares the Church to serve the Lord.
Know that individual members cannot reach full spiritual maturity unless they function within the body as a whole.

Know that the gifted individuals given by Jesus Himself to the Church are to enable all in the body of Christ to unite in the faith and in knowing Jesus to thereby attain spiritual maturity and become fully like Christ.
Know that Christ’s gifts are the means by which each saint is made capable of performing their part in order that the Church may be built up to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ.
Know that spiritual maturity requires a personal relationship with Jesus.
Know that spiritual maturity is to attain the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ.
Know that Jesus is our role model. (He is the best illustration of how to live a Christian life.)
Know that it is God’s unrelenting purpose that every child of God and every church become like the Son of God in maturity.
Know that the standard of maturity for the Church is conformity to Christ.
Know that the fullness of Christ is the abundance of the excellence which Christ bestows.
Don’t allow yourself to remain spiritually immature.
Don’t be unstable and carried about with every wind of doctrine.
Know that the spiritually immature are tossed to and fro and carried about with every wind of doctrine.
Beware those who, by the skillful trickery of false doctrine, lie in wait to deceive you.
Know that immature Christians who are not established in the truth leave themselves wide open to doctrinal error.
Know that false doctrine can unsettle an immature church.
Act and speak sincerely in love so that the Church may grow into the likeness of Christ.
Seek to grow spiritually to become spiritually mature and like Jesus in every way.
Know that as Head of the Church, Jesus leads by example.

Know that it is God’s intention that the Church is tightly knit together and united through the divine supply of every Christ-connected individual working effectively together causing the Church to grow in number and to be built up further in love.
Know that love powers spiritual growth in the Church.
Know that the Christian faith is not to be lived in isolation from the body of Christ.
Know that everyone in the body of Christ has a unique gifting from Christ and important part to play in the Church.
Know that every part of the body is needed and intended to work together.
Know that the Church grows as individuals grow and contribute to the cause of Christ.
Know that God’s plan for your life will benefit others in the body of Christ.
No longer live or behave like those who belong to the world who live only for their own futile pursuits and perverse thoughts.
Embrace the Christian way of life and do not be influenced by the cultures and values of the world.
Know that becoming a Christian radically changes pursuits and attitudes about life.
Know that worldly living and thinking is futile.
Know that worldly people live in spiritual darkness without understanding of God’s purposes.
Know that worldly people are spiritually dead and do not live for God or have any relationship with Him.
Know that worldly people are ignorant because of the hardness of their hearts.
Know that worldly people are insensitive to spiritual matters and prefer to indulge their sensual appetites pleasing their flesh and natural desires in all kinds of impurity.
Know that worldly people do not care what others think about their character, nor do they consider what God thinks about them.
Know that worldly people are never satisfied but continually lust after ways that are even more ungodly.
Know that Jesus did not teach you to live or behave like those who belong to the world.
Know that those in Christ hear His voice.
Know that we have heard directly from Jesus and been instructed personally in fellowship with Him.
Know that Jesus is truth personified.
Know that after we heard and were taught the truth by Jesus, we cast off our former way of life.
Know that our old nature is to be continually corrupted by deceitful desires.
Know that the "old man" and his sin nature, is fuelled and directed by deceitful desires.
Be renewed in the spirit of your mind.
Know that renewal of the mind leads to transformation.
Know that the renewal of our mind is the continual work of the Holy Spirit.
Know that we have the mind of Christ.
Know that the Holy Spirit teaches us the things that have been freely given to us by God.
Know that after we heard and were taught the truth by Jesus, we became a new creation.
Put on the Lord Jesus Christ.
Know that the "new man" is created after the image of God.
Know that the "new man" has a divine nature, having escaped the corruption of deceitful desires.
Know that the "new man" and his new nature, is fuelled and directed by spiritual things through relationship with God and His Word.
Know that the "new man" receives the things of the Spirit which are spiritually discerned.
Know that the "old man" cannot receive the things of the Spirit because they are spiritually discerned.
Stop telling lies and always speak the truth to everyone.
Know that the "old man" is a natural born liar.
Know that the Spirit of truth dwells within the "new man".
Speak the truth to everyone because we are all members of one another (the body of Christ).
Be angry without sinning.
Don’t hold on to your anger; be rid of it before the end of the day.
Don’t give the devil any room to operate anywhere in your life.
Don’t listen to the false accusations or give in to the temptations of the devil.
Stop stealing and work hard instead.
Work hard so that you may have to give to those in need.
Know that work is not just to satisfy your own needs but also those of others.
Let no bad or worthless words come out of your mouth.
Do not speak in an impure or critical way.
Speak kind and encouraging words that bless and build up those who hear.
Do not make the Holy Spirit of God sorrowful by the way that you speak or act.
Know that the Holy Spirit is God’s mark of ownership upon us that reserves us as His until the day of redemption when we will receive our resurrected bodies (when we die or at The Rapture).
Put all bitterness away from you so that you no longer bear grudges or hatred towards anyone.
Put all anger and resentment away from you.
Do not get into heated disputes and shout loud and angry complaints and demands.
Stop all negative, slanderous and evil speaking.
Put away all spiteful thoughts, revenge and unprovoked ill-will towards others.
Become kind to one another.
Become compassionate and sympathetic to one another.
Forgive one another, just as God has forgiven you for Christ’s sake.
